function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Sharing ventilators between 2 patients increases the risk of cross-contamination and spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Potential spread of infectious diseases to multiple patients, leading to higher infection rates and potential severe health complications.","Mitigation":"Implement strict cleaning and sterilization protocols between patient use, and consider alternative solutions to address ventilator shortages.","Technologies":"Advanced sterilization technologies, such as UV-C disinfection, and development of low-cost ventilators for individual patient use.","People":"Patients sharing ventilators and healthcare workers attending to these patients.","Owner":"Healthcare facilities and medical equipment manufacturers."},{"Description":"Use of improvised breathing aids and devices, such as snood-type masks, without proper filtration and purification systems may lead to inadequate protection against airborne viruses.","Impact":"Increased risk of exposure to contaminated air and inhalation of virus particles, contributing to higher infection rates among users.","Mitigation":"Implement effective air filtration and purification systems in the design of breathing aids, and provide training on proper usage and maintenance to healthcare workers and patients.","Technologies":"HEPA filters, UV-C air disinfection, and development of high-efficiency respiratory protective devices.","People":"Patients using breathing aids, healthcare workers, and researchers developing new breathing aid technologies.","Owner":"Medical research institutions, healthcare facilities, and respiratory device manufacturers."},{"Description":"Development of makeshift ventilation solutions using off-the-shelf components and 3D printing techniques may pose risks related to device safety, reliability, and function.","Impact":"Potential device malfunctions, inadequate performance, and safety hazards for patients relying on makeshift ventilators.","Mitigation":"Thorough testing and quality assurance of components, collaboration with regulatory bodies to ensure compliance, and continuous monitoring and maintenance of makeshift ventilator systems.","Technologies":"Quality control standards, regulatory compliance protocols, and advanced monitoring and feedback systems for makeshift ventilators.","People":"Patients depending on makeshift ventilators, healthcare providers, and engineering teams developing makeshift ventilator solutions.","Owner":"Medical engineering departments, regulatory agencies, and healthcare institutions."}]}
